info.title: License Manager API
info.description:
## Welcome!

The License Manager API allows you to create users, modify their names and e-mails, as well as add and remove roles from users.

### ATTRIBUTES

|Attribute name | Description |
|:------------|--------------|
|accountName | Account name in VTEX License Manager |
|environment | Environment on which you want to run the query e.g. vtexcommercestable |
|userId      | Unique user identification string |
|roleId      | Integer that represents a role, can be looked up on the License Manager UI |

get.description: Allows you to get a user from the database, using the `userId` as the identifier.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Id from queried user.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - A null `userId` sends the request to a path that is not allowed.

post.description: Allows you to create a user by providing an e-mail (mandatory) and name (optional). The e-mail must be in a valid format. The success response will contain the generated `userId` for that user.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

put.description: Allows you to add roles to a particular user or application key by specifying the list of roles' ids on the request's body.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Id corresponding to the user

requestBody.description: List of roles' ids to add to the user or application key.

204.description: Success - A no-content response, but the roles were added successfully.

400.description: Bad Request - A userId or role list with invalid format. The message on the body of the response will contain further information.

example.Message: Roles list contains roles that do not exist in this account

500.description: Unexpected error - One possible reason is that the userId is not present on the database.

get.description: Get roles of a particular user or application key.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Id corresponding to the user

delete.description: Allows you to remove a role from a specific user or application key. This method only allows the removal of one role per request. The role's id must be specified on the request path, not on the request body.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Id corresponding to the user

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: Id of the role which will be removed from the user

204.description: Success - A no-content response, but the role deletion was performed successfully.

400.description: Bad Request - A userId or role list with invalid format. The message on the body of the response will contain further information.

post.description: Create a new pair of `appKey` and `appToken`.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

get.description: Get all application keys from an account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

put.description: Activate or deactive an `appKey` by its id.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id from the appKey which will be updated

example.Message: Token not exists for this account

get.description: Get the stores and respective hosts of the account

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

get.description: Retrieves information from an account, such as company and sponsor user details, stores, and appTokens.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

get.description: Returns a list of registered users. The response is divided in pages. The query parameter `numItems` defines the number of items in each page, and consequently the amount of pages for the whole list.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: numItems
parameters.description: Number of items in the returned page

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Which page from the whole list will be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Chooses the field that the list will be sorted by

parameters.name: sortType
parameters.description: Defines the sorting order. `ASC` is used for ascendant order. `DSC` is used for descendant order

get.description: Returns a list of available roles. The response is divided in pages. The query parameter `numItems` defines the number of items in each page, and consequently the amount of pages for the whole list.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type of the body of the request. Default value for license manager protocol is application/json

parameters.name: numItems
parameters.description: Number of items in the returned page

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Which page from the whole list will be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Chooses the field that the list will be sorted by

parameters.name: sortType
parameters.description: Defines the sorting order. ASC is used for ascendant order. DSC is used for descendant order
